4. Attribution Footer

Standard format for crediting sources in analysis views.

Analysis Content

This executive order establishes new frameworks for collaboration between universities and private industry including tax incentives for industry investments in academic research, streamlined technology transfer processes, and joint innovation hubs...

The order affects multiple aspects of university operations, particularly around intellectual property management, international research collaborations, and industry partnership agreements.

Analysis incorporates data from: Council on Governmental Relations (COGR), National Science Foundation (NSF), and American Council on Education (ACE) (retrieved on 02/15/2023)
Single Source Example

This executive order implements new protections for student loan borrowers including expanded loan forgiveness programs, caps on interest rates, and strengthened oversight of loan servicers...

Analysis incorporates data from: American Council on Education (ACE) (retrieved on 03/10/2023)

Implementation Notes

  • All source attribution components are implemented through static HTML and CSS
  • Real implementation includes JavaScript for interactive filtering
  • Components follow accessibility best practices (contrasting colors, proper semantic markup)
  • Source attribution data is exported from the database to JSON for static site generation
  • Citation formats follow standard academic practices while remaining readable
